title.narrative: Punjab Resource Improvement and Digital Effectiveness

description.narrative: To increase own source revenue, and improve reliability of resource allocation and access to digital services for people and firms in the province of Punjab.

condition.narrative: For purpose of verifying the achievement of the DLRs, the Implementing Entity shall engage, not later than six (6) months after theEffective Date, an independent third-party entity or entities (the “Third-Party Independent Verification Agent”), withqualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to the Bank, to undertake the verification process.

P&DB and FD shall prioritize annual development plan schemes supporting program result areas and ensure continuous and predictablerelease of funds for program activities, which shall be assessed at the time of third-party review of program expenditure framework.
The Implementing Entity shall carry out the Program Action Plan in accordance with the schedule set out in the said Program ActionPlan in a manner satisfactory to the Bank.
The Implementing Entity shall ensure that collection, storage, usage or processing of personal data are carried out with due regardto appropriate data protection and privacy standards and practices.

The Implementing Entity shall maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Operation, the Public Financial ManagementReform Steering Committee comprised of officials of various government entities, in adequate numbers and under terms of referencesatisfactory to the Bank, vested with the responsibility of overseeing the implementation of the Operation in their respectiveagencies.

The Implementing Entity shall monitor and evaluate the progress of the Program and the Project and prepare Program Reports inaccordance with the provisions of Section 5.08 of the General Conditions. Each Project Report and Program Report shall cover theperiod of one calendar semester, and shall be furnished to the Borrower not later than thirty (30) days after the end of the periodcovered by such report for incorporation and forwarding by the Borrower to the Bank of the overall Project Report and ProgramReport.

The Implementing Entity shall vest the overall responsibility for the implementation of the Project in its Finance Department andshall maintain, throughout the period of implementation of the Project, the Public Financial Management Unit with the composition,resources and terms of reference satisfactory to the Bank and adequate for successful implementation of the Project.

The Implementing Entity shall:(a) prepare and furnish to the Bank for its review, an Implementation Manual setting out detailedinstitutional, administrative, financial, technical and operational standards and procedures for the implementation of theOperation, Program Action Plan, and including: (i) detailed disbursement calculation formula; (ii) detailed safeguards, financialmanagement (including funds flow and budgeting), personal data collection/processing and procurement arrangements; and (iii) amonitoring and verification system for the Program, in accordance with good international practice, roles and responsibilities forthe implementation of the Operation and such other arrangements and procedures as shall be required for the effectiveimplementation of the Operation, in form and substance satisfactory to the Bank; (b) within three (3) months after the EffectiveDate, adopt such Implementation Manual as shall have been approved by the Bank and thereafter, implement the Operation inaccordance with the Implementation Manual; and(c) shall not amend, abrogate or suspend, or permit to be amended, abrogated orsuspended any provision of the Implementation Manual without the prior written agreement of the Bank.

baseline.value: No linkages among Punjab tax authorities’ databases or with third-parties; PRA & FBR signed MOU for data sharing

target.value: Punjab tax authorities have access to shared data with links to third parties (at least total 10 for PRA),

actual.value: Draft data integration plan is being discussed and yet to be approved. PRA is in discussion with 4 third parties for data linkages.

title.narrative: Additional services provided to citizens and firms online, through a single identity platform

baseline.value: 10 services are provided to citizens online

target.value: 50 Services provided to citizens and firms online

actual.value: 18 services are provided to citizens online

title.narrative: Number of Punjab Urban Local Areas reporting on revenues and expenditure position
Increase in registered taxpayers who filed STS returns in previous year
Citizens accessing government services through digital platforms, of which 20% are female
Increase in number of registered services sales taxpayers
Variance between original budget and actual expenditure composition

baseline.value: Average of three years variance is 18%. (2015-18).

target.value: Average of three years variance (FY22 – FY24) is <10%

actual.value: Joint priorities committee notified; Single ceilings for departments being prepared.

title.narrative: Districts achieving minimum standards for Disaster Risk Reduction

baseline.value: GoPb does not have Disaster Risk Financing Strategy (DRFS)

actual.value: Disaster Risk Financing Strategy is not notified

title.narrative: Strengthened cash management function of Government of Punjab

baseline.value: GoPb does not have cash management policy.

target.value: Cash forecasting reports published on quarterly basis by FD

actual.value: Cash Management Policy and accounting framework are not approved.

title.narrative: Moderate and reduce the annual pension cost of GoPb

baseline.value: In FY19 (30th June), Punjab civil service pension cost 15% of budget

target.value: At least six (cumulative) key parameters implemented of the Pension Reform Plan

actual.value: The Policy Framework for Improved Management of Fiscal Risks yet to be presented to provincial Assembly.

title.narrative: Enhance transparency of commodity debt stock by detailed reporting and gradual reduction in flow of commodity debt by GoPb

baseline.value: In FY20 (30th June), no policy guidelines on contracting & monitoring of commodity debt exist along with strategy to reducecommodity debt flow as well as no detailed disclosure of commodity debt stock.

target.value: Punjab FD ensures no more than PKR20 billion flow in commodity debt stock.

actual.value: No policy guidelines on contracting & monitoring of commodity debt exist along with strategy to reduce commodity debt flow, as wellas no detailed disclosure of commodity debt stock, interest cost and subsidies.

target.value: Own-source tax collection of Rs.300 billion.

actual.value: PKRs 228.65 billion (FY21). First drafts of impact assessment of COVID on revenue, and Punjab Revenue mobilization strategy andimplementation plan have been prepared.

title.narrative: Key business processes for tax administration simplified and automated

baseline.value: Selected BPs automated in few tax authorities (e-payment for 8 taxes of Punjab)

target.value: BP's of taxpayer registration, payment, arrears monitoring and refunds, appeals, litigation and feedback systems simplified andautomated.

actual.value: Plan for BPR and feedback system for tax administration in Punjab, is not available as yet. Monitoring of arrears and refundsprocessing is yet to be reviewed for simplification and automation.

title.narrative: Enhanced capacity for revenue generation from real estate

baseline.value: Substantial difference between official and market values of properties; No market valuation study conducted for public and privateproperties

target.value: Complete properties’ market valuation studies for 6 cities (cumulative) using modern valuation methodology.

actual.value: Review of legal framework and procedures for valuation of properties to align it with modern techniques is not available as yet.Valuation unit has not yet been established.

title.narrative: Operational budget expenditure processed through e-procurement

actual.value: Standard bidding documents prepared, and rules are being revised. Both are yet to be approved by the Board. e-Procurement pilotdepartments have been notified.
